item.title: Ongoing cyberattack at US grocery distributor giant UNFI affecting customer orders
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: United Natural Foods said it is "diligently managing through the cyber incident" that sparked disruption outages.

item.title: Google’s AI search features are killing traffic to publishers
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Google’s AI Overviews and other AI-powered tools, including chatbots, are devastating traffic for news publishers, per a Wall Street Journal report.

item.title: Tebi, the new startup by Adyen’s departed co-founder, raises a fresh €30M from Alphabet’s CapitalG
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Co-founded by Adyen's former CTO, Tebi helps restaurants, bars and other hospitality businesses manage their operations with an all-in-one subscription-based platform that can handle payments, reservations, inventory, and more.

item.title: Waymo robotaxis, Lime e-scooters set ablaze during LA protests
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Several Waymo robotaxis and Lime e-scooters were set ablaze this weekend as unrest in downtown Los Angeles continued.

item.title: WWDC 2025: Everything that Apple ‘Sherlocked’ this time
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Just like every year, Apple has once again built in some features into its operating systems that were previously available through third-party apps.

item.title: Still no AI-powered, ‘more personalized’ Siri from Apple at WWDC 25
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Apple announced a slew of updates at the Worldwide Developer Conference with one notable exception. It still hasn't revealed its previously announced AI-powered Siri.

item.title: Here’s what’s coming to macOS Tahoe
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: At Monday's WWDC conference, Apple announced the new macOS Tahoe, which comes with a series of updates related to Apple Intelligence, continuity features with the iPhone, and Spotlight search.

item.title: After user backlash, Apple brings back tabs to the Photos app in iOS 26
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Apple said Monday at the Worldwide Developers Conference it was bringing back a tabbed interface to Photos in its new OS release.

item.title: OpenAI claims to have hit $10B in annual revenue
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: OpenAI says it recently hit $10 billion in annual recurring revenue, up from around $5.5 billion last year.

item.title: From spatial widgets to realistic Personas: All the visionOS updates Apple announced at WWDC
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Apple’s updates to VisionOS 26, the operating system powering its mixed reality headset, build off last year’s Apple Vision Pro spatial computer that blends digital content with the physical world. At WWDC, Apple announced a range of updates for both consumer and enterprise customers, from new spatial widgets and content to more realistic Personas and more.

item.title: WWDC 2025: Everything announced, including Liquid Glass, Apple Intelligence updates, and more
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal, Sarah Perez
item.description: As in previous years, the company focused on software updates and new technologies, including the next version of iOS, called iOS 26.

item.title: Here are all the iOS 26 rumors that came true at WWDC
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Apple unveiled iOS 26 at WWDC 2025. Here are the several rumors that came true.

item.title: iPadOS 26 will make the iPad feel more like a Mac
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Given the updates to iOS 26 and macOS Tahoe, it’s no wonder that iPadOS 26 is getting its own makeover, too. But Apple is calling this update “the biggest iPadOS release ever,” and we don’t think that’s just PR-speak. The updates to iPadOS 26 include the Liquid Glass design refresh, a new window system, Apple […]

item.title: Startup Battlefield 200: Final call — last day to apply
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: This is it. The gates to Startup Battlefield 200 at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 close tonight. If you want a shot at the most electrifying startup pitch competition in tech, your application needs to be in before the deadline hits. You’ve got vision. Traction. A product that’s making noise. Now’s the time to show up on […]

item.title: Apple updates Spotlight to take actions on your Mac
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Apple announced some of its biggest updates ever to Spotlight, the Mac's on-device search feature, during WWDC 2025 on Monday. In macOS Tahoe, Spotlight can be used to run shortcuts and take hundreds of actions, such as writing emails, setting reminders, and playing podcasts.

item.title: Apple brings ChatGPT and other AI models to Xcode
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: At WWDC 2025, Apple released a new version of Xcode, its app development suite, that integrates OpenAI's ChatGPT for coding, doc generation, and more. The company also announced that developers can use API keys to bring AI models from other providers to Xcode for AI-powered programming suggestions.

item.title: Apple TV’s tvOS 26 gets ‘Liquid Glass’ treatment and profile-switching feature
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Apple revealed tvOS 26 during WWDC 2025, featuring a "Liquid Glass" aesthetic for Apple TV.

item.title: At WWDC 2025, Apple introduces an AI-powered Shortcuts app
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Users will be able to access the AI models either on device or with Private Compute to generate responses that feed into the rest of their shortcut.

item.title: Mitra Chem is raising $50M for its cheaper, domestic battery materials
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Mitra Chem is developing materials to make lithium-iron-phosphate (LFP) batteries store more energy.

item.title: Apple’s new Workout Buddy helps you sweat smarter
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Apple has launched at its WWDC 2025 conference Workout Buddy, an AI workout coach. The AI tool gathers data from both your current workout and your fitness history – including paces, miles logged, activity rings closed, and training load – to coach you through workouts in real time.
